dt: {bc}the physical or social setting in which something occurs or {d_link|develops|develop} {bc}{sx|environment||}

pt: {sc}background{/sc} {sc}setting{/sc} {sc}environment{/sc} {sc}milieu{/sc} {sc}mise-en-scène{/sc} mean the place, time, and circumstances in which something occurs. {sc}background{/sc} often refers to the circumstances or events that precede a phenomenon or development.

pt.t: the shocking decision was part of the {it}background{/it} of the riots

pt: {sc}setting{/sc} suggests looking at real-life situations in literary or dramatic terms.

pt.t: a militant reformer who was born into an unlikely social {it}setting{/it}

pt: {sc}environment{/sc} applies to all the external factors that have a formative influence on one's physical, mental, or moral development.

pt.t: the kind of {it}environment{/it} that produces juvenile delinquents

pt: {sc}milieu{/sc} applies especially to the physical and social surroundings of a person or group of persons.

pt.t: an intellectual {it}milieu{/it} conducive to artistic experimentation

pt: {sc}mise-en-scène{/sc} strongly suggests the use of properties to achieve a particular atmosphere or theatrical effect.

pt.t: a gothic thriller with a carefully crafted {it}mise-en-scène{/it}

quotes.t: They're caught in their own hazy {qword}milieu{/qword}—working, smoking, talking, drinking.
Theirs was a bohemian {qword}milieu{/qword} in which people often played romantic musical chairs.
She might stay home, might marry and live as a housewife. And if her {qword}milieu{/qword} does not sanction such a solution, there are, she knows, {qword}milieux{/qword} which do.
People in France admire the United States, and much of what passes for anti-Americanism is limited to the intellectual {qword}milieu{/qword} of Paris.

Certainly there are very few American {qword}milieus{/qword} today in which having read the latest work of Joyce Carol Oates or Richard Ford is more valuable, as social currency, than having caught the latest John Travolta movie or knowing how to navigate the Web.

et: French, from Old French, midst, from {it}mi{/it} middle (from Latin {it}medius{/it}) + {it}lieu{/it} place, from Latin {it}locus{/it} {ma}{mat|mid|}, {mat|stall|}{/ma}
shortdef: the physical or social setting in which something occurs or develops : environment
